title: Developer Engagement Workflow Product Manager
summary: At Apple, we build products that enrich people’s lives. The Tools and Frameworks group enables developers inside and outside of Apple to build amazing products and platforms using Xcode, Xcode Cloud and more! The Developer Engagement team’s Workflow Product Managers are responsible for understanding how developers complete their work daily using a variety of products. The Developer Engagement Workflow Manager focuses specifically on testing workflows and looks to improve the ability for engineers and QA to test their code.
description:
-  Ownership of the end-to-end testing workflow product
-  Understand, influence, and coordinate the roadmaps for all products that support the testing workflow product at Apple
-  Deeply understand the way Apple engineers test their code and what problems they encounter when testing, including the use of devices
-  Stay current with the latest testing and general software development techniques and methodologies from outside of Apple
-  Build collaborative relationships with the product owners, designers, engineers, and stakeholders developing our testing tools and frameworks
-  Collect and synthesize feedback from all channels including Research, Metrics, Support, Field Engineering, Account Managers, and direct interaction with users.
-  Collaborate with Researchers to discover and document the testing workflows of engineers at Apple
-  Establish and supervise key metrics related to the test workflows and the use of testing tools and frameworks across Apple
-  Regularly present testing feedback, insights, and strategy to Apple leadership
key_qualifications:
10+ years in software development with 5+ in Product Management.
Expertise in modern Product Management methodologies
Strong metrics and data analysis skills
Experience influencing partners and roadmaps without direct authority
Collaborative working relationship with engineers, designers, and account managers
Excellent writing and presentation skills
education_experience: BA/BS or MA/MS in related field
